com.kontakt.sdk.android.connection

Class ServiceConnectionChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.android.connection.ServiceConnectionChain

  • public class ServiceConnectionChain
extends Object
    Service connection chain. Service connection chain allows to connect or disconnect Service connectors (ServiceConnector) in the order in which they are specified performing connecting firstly and disconnecting secondly. According to applied philosophy in SDK objects which implement ServiceConnector interface are backed by corresponding Services (Service) which execute tasks. Sometimes, in order to reach certain effect which combines several Service connectors responsibilities, the connectors must collaborate with themselves. Backing service, when connected, responds to the manager asynchronously. Thus, the collaboration initalization may be executed in an inappropriate way and service may be scheduled to execute task when it is not ready yet. ServiceConnectionChain ensures that each Manager with backing service will be connected in the order in which they are applied during its initialization and then each will be disconnected according to the same rules. Sometimes an error may occur during Manager connection. As a result, the RemoteException (RemoteException) is thrown. In this case every manager which successfully connected to the backing service before the unsuccessful one will be disconnected. In other words, if one of the Service Connectors fails, a connection rollback will be performed on previous ones and the chain will disconnect them. The next connectors will not be connected.
